newsitem.title: USA: Soros group to buy Indigo pfd, warrants.
newsitem.headline: Soros group to buy Indigo pfd, warrants.

text.p: A group led by international financier George Soros said Monday it has begun negotiating with Indigo NV to buy additional convertible preferred shares and warrants in a transaction that could be valued at about $10 million.

In a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, the group, which holds the equivalent of 20.42 million shares, or a 30.35 percent stake, in the Dutch company, said the amount is undetermined but that the transaction would be done through a private placement.

Indigo is a Dutch corporation that researches, develops and produces electronic printing products. The Soros group in the SEC filing said the company has estimated that it would receive about $10 million from the pending transaction.
"The reporting persons may purchase a portion of the convertible preferred shares and warrants offered in the private placement," the Soros group said in the SEC filing.

In May of last year, the Soros group first reported holding a stake in Indigo. At that time, the group said it holds the securities for investment purposes. It did not indicate in the Monday filing a change in its intentions.
